channel.title: 2020 Issues on MillMint
channel.description: Recent content in 2020 Issues on MillMint

item.title: Issue 1 | May 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the inaugural issue of The Atlantic, a monthly bulletin for enthusiasts and fans of the Petticoat Project, Vekllei, Tzipora and its constellation of interests and affairs. For the benefit of compatibility, The Atlantic is published in websafe typography to keep this bulletin looking great on any screen.

item.title: Issue 2 | June 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the second issue of The Atlantic, closing a quiet month for the Petticoat Project that has ushered in several new beginnings. A comic; a new website; new friends â€” June was a good month. The posts this month departed from the slice-of-life conventions of May, reintroducing maps and infographics to the project.

item.title: Issue 3 | July 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the third issue of The Atlantic. This is the month of postcards, and feeling tired. There are fewer posts this month â€” and aside from Veklleiâ€™s Race for Inefficiency, theyâ€™ve all been pretty tepid stuff. Thereâ€™s good reason for that, and hopefully weâ€™ll be back to regular production next month.

item.title: Issue 4 | August 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the fourth issue of The Atlantic. Good posts this month. Bit of a smorgasbord, with stories covering all sorts of things. Most importantly, as was mentioned last month: I want to start a comic. How do you go about starting a comic? I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s much of a trick to it, as a first-timer â€” you just have to â€™startâ€™.

item.title: Issue 5 | September 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the fifth issue of The Atlantic. I hope you like stories â€” because this month was all about little snippets of life in Vekllei. There is a correlation between how nice a picture looks and how short the accompanying story is. Recently, as Iâ€™ve finished paintings later and later into the early morning, the posts that follow show signs of my fatigue.

item.title: Issue 6 | October 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the sixth issue of The Atlantic. Big announcements, short bulletin. Iâ€™ve started work on Atomic Modern, better known as â€™the Vekllei comic.â€™ Iâ€™m about five pages in so far. I have a distinct style of illustration, but that doesnâ€™t always translate well to a panel format, and navigating that fact has been a real challenge.

item.title: Issue 7 | November 2020
item.description: .markdown a { color: var(--color-yellow); } The Atlantic Bulletin ðŸŒ¼ BULLETIN Documents Back to Issues From the Editor # Welcome to the sixth issue of The Atlantic. Novemberâ€™s a bitch. This was a hard month, evidenced in part by the smaller number of posts. Personal problems and some bad news are enough to derail plans, Iâ€™m afraid, and so other things had to take their place.
